Package es.codeurjc.services

Class UserService

java.lang.Object
es.codeurjc.services.UserService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
@Service public class UserService extends Object implements Serializable
Service that manage all about authenticate and serves the process of login and register of someone inside the Web Application
Version:
1.9
Author:
gu4re
See Also:

    Fields

    Field
    Description
    private static Map<String,String>
    usersMap
    Fake database that controls the users registered in the App and maps the email of the User (Key) with the password previously hashed (Value)

  • Field Details

    • usersMap

      private static Map<String,String> usersMap
      Fake database that controls the users registered in the App and maps the email of the User (Key) with the password previously hashed (Value)

  • Constructor Details

    • UserService

      private UserService()
      Private constructor avoiding initialize of Service

  • Method Details

    • run

      @EventListener @Deprecated(since="1.3") public static void run(org.springframework.context.event.ContextRefreshedEvent event)
      Deprecated.
      This method can only be used by SpringBeanSystem so abstain from using it
      Starts the UserService connecting the database to the Service.

      An error can occur if the database is not found (IOException) or reading casting fails during deserialize process inside database (ClassNotFoundException) in both cases the app will run with a new and empty database

    • stop

      @Deprecated(since="1.2") @EventListener public static void stop(org.springframework.context.event.ContextClosedEvent event)
      Deprecated.
      This method can only be used by SpringBeanSystem so abstain from using it
      Stops the UserService before the Spring Application ends, saving the database to a binary file

    • authenticate

      public static boolean authenticate(@NotNull @NotNull String email, @NotNull @NotNull String rawPassword)
      Carriers the authenticate process of the web application, checking if the user passed as parameter is already registered
      Parameters:
      email - The email to be checked
      rawPassword - The plain password to be checked
      Returns:
      True if the user is already registered otherwise False

    • userExists

      public static boolean userExists(@NotNull @NotNull String email)
      Check if a user exists or not
      Parameters:
      email - The user's email to be checked
      Returns:
      True if the user exists otherwise False

    • addUser

      public static void addUser(@NotNull @NotNull String email, @NotNull @NotNull String rawPassword)
      Register the user inside the database
      Parameters:
      rawPassword - The user's plain password to be added into database
      email - The user's email to be added into database

    • changePassword

      @NotNull public static @NotNull org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> changePassword(@NotNull @NotNull String email, @NotNull @NotNull String newRawPassword)
      Changes the password of the user that has email passed as parameter
      Parameters:
      email - the user's mail
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity based of what happened in the Service returning 200 OK if all goes good, 400 Bad Request if not and otherwise 404 Not Found if any resource is not able

    • removeUser

      public static void removeUser(@NotNull @NotNull String email)
      Remove a user passed an email
      Parameters:
      email - the email passed by the controller
